meanings.definition: A group of similar things or people gathered closely together.
meanings.sent1: The clustering of stars in the night sky was a beautiful sight.
meanings.sent2: The clustering of students around the playground equipment showed their excitement.
meanings.sent3: The clustering of ducks at the pond made it look like a feathery party.
meanings.sent4: The clustering of colorful balloons created a festive atmosphere at the party.
meanings.sent5: The clustering of ripe berries on the bush was a tempting sight for the hungry birds.

meanings.definition: The act of forming a cluster or clusters.
meanings.sent1: The clustering of ants near the picnic area was a sign of trouble.
meanings.sent2: The clustering of clouds in the sky indicated a possible storm approaching.
meanings.sent3: The clustering of toys in the playroom made it challenging to walk without stepping on them.
meanings.sent4: The clustering of colorful umbrellas on the beach looked like a vibrant mosaic.
meanings.sent5: The clustering of leaves on the ground created a crunchy carpet in the autumn park.

meanings.definition: The process of organizing data into groups based on similarities.
meanings.sent1: The clustering of books on the shelves by genre made it easier to find a specific one.
meanings.sent2: The clustering of cars in the parking lot by color was an interesting sight.
meanings.sent3: The clustering of emojis in the chat made the conversation more lively.
meanings.sent4: The clustering of ingredients on the kitchen counter inspired the chef to start cooking.
meanings.sent5: The clustering of stars in constellations helped ancient navigators find their way across the seas.
